intro: Restrepia antennifera var. maculata, commonly known as the spotted restrepia, is a hybrid orchid species native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is characterized by its compact, upright growth habit and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. The leaves are typically dark green with a velvety texture and often bear distinctive spots or markings, giving it its common name. This variety is well-suited for intermediate to warm climates and requires well-draining soil and bright, indirect light. It is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
